timeline.message: Dropping guava and appcompat dependency from FIS SDK.

Fix OverlappingFileLockException.

Access the data shared by multiple threads only after acquiring cross-process and multi-thread safe locks.

Avoid throwing explcit IOExceptions.

Also, handle slow network connection issues by retrying and back off.

timeline.bodyText:
Can we just throw 1 exception type here?
Or where happens the unification (of exception types) for users?
timeline.author: andirayo

timeline.bodyText:
Why do we catch FirebaseException here?
a) Do we ever use any Exception type other than FirebaseInstallationsException?
If yes: why? If no: I recommend to check for FirebaseInstallationsException here.
b) Why do we catch FirebaseInstallationsException?
catching and rethrowing the same exception is an antipattern.
Can we not just leave the FirebaseInstallationsException as is?
timeline.author: andirayo

replies.bodyText:
Update to check only FirebaseInstallationsException.
Agreed on the anti-pattern. Updated the code to remove this code.
I don't know the reason why we had this anti-pattern behavior before.
replies.author: ankitaj224

timeline.bodyText:
What "backoff" are you referring to?
Exponential backoff?
If this is a public comment, I think I would either omit this addition or frame it like this:
"This is a most likely due to a transient condition and may be corrected by retrying. We recommend exponential backoff when retrying requests."
